etymologies: Latin, from Greek hibiskos, which Dioscorides identified with the marsh mallow

definitions: a plant of the mallow family, grown in warm climates for its large brightly colored flowers or for products such as fiber or timber.

notes.text: Genus Hibiscus, family Malvaceae: many species, including the rose mallow

shortDefinitions: plant of mallow family, grown in warm climates for its large brightly coloured flowers or for products
